title: Abdullah of Saudi Arabia - Wikipedia
snippet: According to various reports, Abdullah married up to 30 times and had more than 35 children. He was among the wealthiest royals in the world. Upon his death in 2015 at age 90, he was succeeded as King by his half-brother Salman, although Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman would become de facto ...

title: Abdullah of Saudi Arabia | King, Biography, History, & Facts | Britannica
snippet: Before becoming king, Abdullah served as crown prince from 1982 to 2005 and was the de facto ruler after King Fahd’s stroke in 1995. The 2002 Arab Peace Initiative called for Israel to withdraw from territories occupied in 1967 in exchange for full Arab normalization of relations with Israel. Abdullah introduced moderate reforms, including limited deregulation, foreign investment, privatization, and the country’s first municipal elections based on adult male suffrage. title: Abdullah bin Abdulaziz
snippet: King Abdullah’s life was marked by significant achievements on local, regional, and global scales. Domestically, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia experienced remarkable advancements during his reign, driven by his commitment to sectors such as education, health, housing, infrastructure, environmental sustainability, water, electricity, e-government, telecommunications, and large-scale economic development projects.

title: King Abdullah’s achievements — Future generations to benefit from reforms - Saudi Gazette
snippet: Under the leadership of King Abdullah, Saudi Arabia came in the forefront of countries that gave more attention to education and healthcare through pumping billions of riyals for new universities and medical cities.

title: King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Biography Center |
snippet: Abdullah bin Abdulaziz bin Abdulrahman Al Saud: The 6th King of Saudi Arabia and the 10th son of King Abdulaziz, was born and educated in Riyadh, he was appointed head of the National Guard in 1963, and improved it from traditional units to a major military institution. King Khalid appointed him as the second deputy, then crown prince under King Fahd reign. In 2005, he became the king of the country, and his reign witnessed achievements ...
